Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an attempt to suppress free speech and free ideas in a democratic country.
The government is perceived to be exempting itself from the directives of the bill, while being a major source of misinformation and disinformation.
The submission cites past events, such as the Covid-19 pandemic and other historical incidents, as examples of government misinformation.
The author argues that the public needs protection from government and mainstream media lies, not from social media misinformation.
Main Themes: Criticism of government and mainstream media
Notable Quotes: I write to display my great displeasure of the Commonwealth Government's attempt to close down the flow of free speech and free ideas, between our people, in this supposedly democratic country.

It is not that the public need to be protected from a few demented characters using the social media that legislation needs to be put in place, but the protection from Government and Main Stream Media lies and deception is probably what is needed.
